Class Game

java.lang.Object
  Game

public class Game
extends Object

This is the Game class that is the central class. The game object represents a real life Rummy Game object and has the neccesary attributes.

Version:
1.0(Basic)
Author:
Nived.Kodavali

          A Deck object which contains the discard pile.

          A Deck object which contains the pack (The pile where you draw your Cards from)

          has the player attributes such as the 'hands', different set combinations etc.

          It is a check condition to find out when a game is over

Method Detail

begin

public static void begin()
                  throws Exception
This method begins the game. It creates a Game object

Throws:
Exception

checkWin

public static void checkWin(Deck deck)
                     throws Exception
This is a security check method to ensure that a player is not bluffing. When a player declares that he has won, it checks if the player really has.

Parameters:
deck - The hand which the Player claims to be a Rummy hand.
Throws:
Exception

checkWinComps

public static void checkWinComps()

play

public void play()
          throws Exception
This method is invohed on this Game. It is the central method and the game continues till the loop in the method is iterating. It is like a mediator method between the player and the computer. It does the functions like asking a player the Card he/she wants to pick, the card he/she wants to play etc. It also invokes the method which starts off the artificial intelligece part of the game.

Throws:
Exception
